author: cq01
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```none
Click PowerShell-7.0.0-preview.4-win-x64.msix.
Then click "install"
```

# Expected behavior

```none
powershell should be installed.
```

# Actual behavior


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17787354/66717663-0c033380-ee0e-11e9-9146-92f28b4a6c0f.png)


# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

I then installed it via .msi
